title: Teaching
text:
I have experience teaching courses both at the bachelor and master’s level at Aarhus University, Heinrich Heine University, and the University of Milan.

Electoral Systems: Do They Really Matter? (MA course, Aarhus; course convenor and lecturer). Syllabus.
Electoral Systems and Representation (BA course, HHU; course convenor and lecturer).
Positive Political Theory (MSc course, Milan; teaching assistant).
Political Institutions: Western Countries, EU, and Foreign Policy (Aarhus, teaching assistant)

title: Edoardo Alberto Viganò
text:
Email
  
  
    
     Twitter
  
  
    
     Bluesky
  
  
    
     Scholar
  
  
    
     Linkedin
  

  
  
Welcome! I am a postdoctoral researcher at the Department of Philosophy, Politics, and Economics at Witten/Herdecke University. Previously, I was a PhD candidate at Aarhus University, Department of Political Science.
In my dissertation, I study the determinants and the consequences of legislators’ efforts to represent local constituents through parliamentary activities. My research interests include parliaments, party politics, and electoral systems. Methodologically, I am interested in quantitative text analysis and causal inference.
You can contact me at edoardo.vigano@uni-wh.de. My CV can be downloaded here.


PhD in Political Science  Aarhus University  2024
MSc in Economics and Political Science  University of Milan  2019
BA in Political Sciences  University of Milan  2017

title: Edoardo Alberto Viganò
text:
Publications
Viganò, E.A. (2024) “Geographical Representation and Re-Election Prospects in Party-Centred Contexts”. Accepted at Journal of Elections, Public Opinion and Parties.
Viganò, E.A. (2023) “Electoral Incentives and Geographical Representation: Evidence from an Italian Electoral Reform”. Legislative Studies Quarterly | Paper.
